root: ^Moon: You seem down. Not shining as bright as usual.
^Astra: I'm normally so invested in my work, but since meeting Noelani, things don't feel the same.
^Astra: My mind always keeps wandering back to her: wondering what she’d think of all the stuff in space, thinking about her jokes…
^Astra: I’m a bit worried about her too. She looked like she had something to say before I left, but didn’t say whatever was on her mind.
^Astra: She's all I can think about.
^Moon: Is there anything I can do to help?
^Moon: Love comes in many forms, my dear.
^Moon: Each is unique, and bears its own caveats.
^Astra: Is what I'm feeling for Noelani — this confusion and aching — is this what love feels like?
^Moon: ...That's not something I can decide for you, child.
^Moon: Perhaps a good starting point is asking yourself why you feel this way.
^Moon: Is it Noelani, or is it something else?
^Moon: What is the source of your confusion?
^Moon: Why are you so focused on what love means?
^Moon: Yet only limiting it as something you feel for and give to others?
^Astra: I can’t exactly give something to myself, can I?
^Moon: Love must come from somewhere, doesn’t it?
^Moon: You seem to be focusing on your love for another to distract from looking at yourself... why?
^Moon: Is having love for oneself so foreign to you? What do you not want to see?
^Astra: After I... Burned Out and fell... when I was stuck down on Earth...
^Astra: I was scared... frustrated... worried that all my potential and work to be great would be lost...
^Astra: but after a while, part of me was... relieved.
^Astra: It was... freeing being able to do nothing.
^Astra: It was relaxing— which is SO weird.
^Astra: I’ve only ever felt relaxed after I made huge strides in being Bright.
^Astra: But I had the same feeling after making NO progress?
^Astra: I’ve worked so hard for so long to live up to my potential of being the “Best and Brightest the night had to offer”...
^Astra: I’ll have to work just as hard to stay Bright.
^Astra: I enjoy the results I get from all my work, but trying to push myself as hard as I did before just… feels pointless.
^Astra: Perhaps I've been pushing myself too hard.
^Astra: Maybe… maybe it's about finding balance. In continuing to pursue my goals while also allowing myself time to just… well, be.
^Moon: That’s very wise, It seems you learned a lot during your stay on Earth. I’m very glad I got the chance to see how you’ve grown.
^Astra:  I wouldn't have realised if I didn’t meet Noelani and Ocean.
^Astra: When I was down there with Noleani it started to feel like…
^Astra: ...well, like becoming Bright wasn't the only thing in my life anymore.
^Astra: It was almost as though she'd become just as important to me.
^Astra: She was so passionate, so sweet to those around her. It was astounding.
^Astra: It was almost like I got to view the world through her eyes. It was so beautiful.
^Astra: Meeting others so relaxed was strange, too.
^Astra: They worked when they needed to, but usually they just… took it easy?
^Astra: I hadn’t realized how long it's been since I talked to anyone else but you, Moon.
^Astra: It was hard being stuck down there with no else I knew, but once I got to know Noelani...
^Moon: Aaahh, the little sea nymph that came to see you off?
^Astra: Yeah the one with cute hair! She’s easy to talk to, and cool, and funny—
^Astra: I don't think I’ve laughed as much up here in years as I did in that month down on Earth.
^Moon: Dawww, you’re very clearly smitten with this little nymph.
^Moon: You remind me of when I first meet the ocean…
^Moon: Such a courageous little nymph! Determined too, given that she’s almost here…
^Astra: Wait, what? What do you mean she's almost here?
